--- Silk Road School <silk.road.school@...>
wrote:

> According to the one book I've ever seen that
> discusses the matter in any
> detail - _Spike and Chain_  (covering
> manriki-kusari, shuriken and shaken) -
> "shuriken" refers only to the spike, dart and knife
> types of throwing
> weapon - basically, those which are only bilaterally
> symmetrical.
> The radially symmetrical ones - discs, stars,
> triangles, squares- are
> properly termed "shaken".  The book was out in the
> early '70s, before the
> cresting of the wave of ninja silliness, and it
> appeared to be fairly
> solidly researched.  I shed my copy back in '75, so
> I can't cite the
> author's name.
> Nate, don't go thinking I'm one of your "resident
> ninja masters" on account
> of this, okay?
> Gereg

Gereg--

I'm glad--I'd be afraid of being killed in the night.
My SECOM security system is no match for a ninja
master!

Basically the shaken/shuriken thing is what I meant.
Having nothing to quote, I went from memory, and added
the caveat about "other names". Thanks for the
update--correct info is never bad! (Unless you are the
government). 

Nate
